other.title: Styledown
other.author: Rico Sta. Cruz
other.description: A markdown dialect to help you write CSS styleguides efficiently.

other.title: StyleDocco
other.description: StyleDocco generates documentation and style guide documents from your stylesheets.

other.title: Pattern Primer
other.description: Create little snippets of markup and save them to the "patterns folder." The pattern primer will generate a list of all the patterns in that folder. You will see the pattern rendered as HTML. You will also get the source displayed in a textarea.

other.title: kss-node Styleguide
other.description:
Inspired by TomDoc, KSS attempts to provide a methodology for writing maintainable, documented CSS within a team. Specifically, KSS is a documentation specification and styleguide format. It is not a preprocessor, CSS framework, naming convention, or specificity guideline.

KSS is a set of guidelines to help you produce an HTML styleguide tied to CSS documentation that is nice to read in plain text, yet structured enough to be automatically extracted and processed by a machine.

other.title: The Living Style Guide gem
other.description: The easiest way to create front-end style guides with Sass and Compass

other.title: Hologram
other.description: Hologram is a Ruby gem that parses comments in your CSS and turns them into a beautiful style guide.

other.title: Pattern Lab
other.description: Pattern Lab is a collection of tools to help you create atomic design systems.

other.title: Sassdown
other.description: Grunt plugin for building living styleguides with Handlebars from Markdown comments in CSS, SASS and LESS files.
